channel.title: Graphics Card
channel.description: What do you guys think is a good graphics card, that provides a top of line output quality, but for a good price? I'm going for an intel, high quality build, so what do you think is my best choice in card?

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

Lol, gtx 690 sli if you are willing to spend thousands
it will definetly run more than 400 fps for any game
but
580,680,690
and slis are the best way to go
radeon 7970 is almost on par with 680
btw 690 is basically a 680 sli

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I have the GTX 680, but if you got the cash and you want something a little more than the GTX 560, then try out the 670, really good performance:price ratio. Otherwise I’d go with the 560, last time I checked it was going soooo cheap

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

560ti or 570, have 560ti and does fine. Not max settings but I only have to turn down small stuff that you can’t really see (shadow quality and worst case scenario turn aa off) but I always want 60 fps and im on a pretty big monitor. It can run everything maxed 40+ fps easily

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:13, topic:466389”]for the love of god if you’re planning on getting a nvidia card and a ti edition exists get it, better performance for about the same price

e.g., 550 ti > 550, 560 ti > 560[/quote]

He linked to the 560ti 448, you can’t get any better in the 560 line

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

I would pick the 560ti 448, you can’t get much better without going up a huge step in price. If you need it later you can always SLI another one. The normal 560ti can play bf3 on ultra without any hiccups. The 448 has a wider bus and trades a slightly lower clock (~100mhz) for more cores so theoretically you should have no problem at all.

A good place to watch would be Amazon, last week when I added the card to my wish list it was a 35% off discount, sadly its back near normal price

amazon.com

Amazon.com: EVGA GeForce GTX560Ti 448 Core CLASSIFIED ULTRA 1280MB GDDR5 SLI Graphics Cards 012-P3-2078-KR: Computers & Accessories

Discover the incredibly detailed world of DirectX 11 with the EVGA GeForce GTX560 Ti 448 Cores CLASSIFIED ULTRA graphics card. loaded with the latest gaming technologies the EVGA GTX560 Ti 448 Cores C ...

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

That is the same exact card I’m hoping to get for Christmas. Don’t forget, you will most likely need to upgrade your power supply too, which could be anywhere from $50-$100 for a decent one.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I have a GTX 560ti, and it has really good performance for the price. I’m pretty happy with it, I can run all my new games on maximum setting with a pretty good constant frame rate. Although since I’m a whore, I could still use a bit more. All the cards that perform better than the GTX 560ti are just so much more expensive.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

My gaming laptop has a 540 and runs every game smoothly.
If you want a good one that will also run close future games smoothly on ultra, go for at least 550 so the one you linked looks alright.
Also watch out for the transfer speeds, I mean if your computer doesn’t support PCI-express 2.0 then don’t fucking buy it,
waste of money, you’d just be creating a bottle neck.

ps: go pro go ssd

Read full topic

Oh well if you’ve got that kind of money, then sure, go for it. As for getting screwed, make sure the seller has at least a 99.8% good feedback rate, or find someone else.

I like this one:

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Well surely you have a debit card, since you’ve ordered from Newegg. Just create a Paypal and add that card. Problem solved.

item.title: Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

http://www.videocardbenchmark.net/high_end_gpus.html Then select ones that will give you a good enough performance for what you want. Find them on eBay and avoid ordering from sites like Amazon, Newegg, etc… I’ve been using eBay for all my computer stuff lately and I don’t regret it at all.

Read full topic
